page.title: 03Education and employment1925
page.content:
NEWBRIDGE IN 1925 (contd) _________________________ researched by Liane Davies
Q.What was the education like? Education was of a very poor standard and you only had primary education until the 1930's when Greenfield Central School was built.Children had to pass an entrance exam.If they failed they had to stay in the primary school until aged 14 years. Q. and what about the employment? The employment then was mainly mining which was under private enterprise and was never regular for example,men would go to work every morning dressed for work in their dirty clothes yet only half of them would be able to work.Some women worked in the tin works in Abercarn.
